descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of how location and physical setting influenced the founding of the colonies.
Demonstrates minimal understanding; struggles to connect geography to colonial development.
Demonstrates basic understanding; identifies some connections between geography and colonial development, but with limited detail.
Demonstrates satisfactory understanding; explains several ways location and physical setting influenced the founding of the colonies with reasonable detail.
Demonstrates thorough understanding; clearly explains how location and physical setting significantly shaped the founding and development of the colonies with specific examples.

Demonstrates comprehensive understanding; insightfully explains the multifaceted ways in which location and physical setting determined the distinct character and development of the colonies, including analysis of long-term impacts.
Unable to locate any of the 13 colonies or American Indian nations on a map.
Struggles to locate the colonies and American Indian nations on a map; many errors present.
Locates some of the colonies and American Indian nations on a map with some errors.
Accurately locates most of the colonies and American Indian nations on a map.
Accurately locates all 13 colonies and several major American Indian nations on a map.
Accurately locates all 13 colonies and a variety of American Indian nations on a map, demonstrating precise geographic knowledge and understanding of historical locations.
Shows no awareness of the presence or significance of American Indian nations in the colonial era.
Demonstrates minimal awareness; suggests American Indian nations were present but provides no detail or context.
Demonstrates basic awareness; acknowledges the presence of American Indian nations and provides limited context.
Demonstrates satisfactory understanding; identifies specific American Indian nations and their general locations relative to the colonies.
Demonstrates thorough understanding; explains the interactions and relationships between specific American Indian nations and the colonies, with attention to geographic context.

Demonstrates comprehensive understanding; analyzes the complex interactions, conflicts, and relationships between specific American Indian nations and the colonies, demonstrating a nuanced understanding of the geographic and historical context.
